2.3.0: Integration with Checkmarx One policies for optional pull-request merge blocking.
Optimized the SARIF log delivery feature to avoid unnecessary API calls.
Github releases now include this release note content in the release description.
2.2.0: Optional SARIF logs are generated for push events to protected or default branches.  Delivery options include POSTing the log to an HTTP endpoint or delivery to an AMQP exchange.
Fixed a CORS error when displaying PR feedback images in some SCM PR threads.
2.1.5: "Distributed Resolver Agents" are now known as "Scan Agents" since the scope of what they do has changed.
Any installations of the Distributed Resolver Agent will need to be uninstalled prior to installing the Scan Agent.
Scan Agents support a pre-scan shell script execution step in addition to an optional execution of SCA Resolver.
Some configuration element names have changed with the transition to the use of the term Scan Agents and may break existing configurations.
A fix was made for an error with automatic group assignments when `*.project-groups.update-groups` is set to `True`.
2.1.4: Pull request feedback result sections are now sorted by a composition of severity and issue elements relevant to the type of issue.  Results will appear in order from highest to lowest severity.
Slightly improved presentation of pull request feedback content.
Failures due to git submodules are now handled better.  If submodules fail to update, the scan will execute without the submodules.
Fix an issue where ADO policies applied as prefixes to branches would miss-classify some policy branches as non-protected.

YAML examples have been moved out of the manual and can now be downloaded from the release artifacts list on GitHub.  This will prevent hidden/unicode characters and preserve indentation when copying the text from the PDF.
2.1.3: Bug fix for group assignment configuration naming.
Bug fix to gracefully handle ADO API branch policy responses not containing `refName` elements.
2.1.2: Azure DevOps: Any branch that has a policy assigned is now considered a protected branch in addition to the repository's default branch.
Project names can now be dynamically generated by using a project naming script.
Legacy default project names can optionally be converted to a new dynamic name upon receipt of the next webhook event.
Projects can now be automatically assigned to groups upon project create.
Existing projects can optionally be updated to the appropriate assigned groups upon handling the next webhook event.
Documentation updates have been made to clarify some of the the YAML configuration elements.
A bug was fixed that would cause repositories that have broken symbolic links to abort the scan orchestration.
The git cloning will now recursively resolve submodules.
A container healthcheck has been added.
Performance improvements when zipping files to upload for scanning.
The CxOneFlow process now runs as a low-privilege user.
2.1.1: Added a kickoff API for use with `cxone-flow-audit` to iterate SCM repositories and perform an initial scan.
Added severity icons for pull request details.
Fixed a bug where unexpected severity values caused PR decoration failures.
2.1.0: Fixed a branch naming bug that affected names of scanned branches that had "/" separated segments.
Fixed an issue with the resolver agent failing when no resolver options are provided.

A breaking configuration change was implemented such that `repo-match` values that are a wildcard match for any value are no longer allowed.  This is to prevent potential SSRF attacks exposing SCM credentials if the SCM shared secret is compromised.  The route match should, at minimum, specify common parts of the FQDN portion of the Git clone URL. Please consult the documentation for more information.
2.0.0: This version is compatible with any configuration YAML that works with version 1.3.  If you are using an external message queue (e.g. not the message queue running internally in the CxOneFlow container), please see the documentation regarding "Upgrading CxOneFlow from 1.x to 2.x".
Refactored to use the shared library `cxone-async-api` instead of an embedded copy of the `cxone_api` code.
Added support for dependency resolution execution using SCA Resolver prior to executing a scan.
The `cxoneflow-resolver-agent` is available for Debian platforms.  This is the agent that executes SCA Resolver.
The `cxoneflow-resolver-agent` supports SCA Resolver execution via containers using the `cx-supply-chain-toolkit`.
The server YAML configuration documentation has been updated to add clarity about the YAML configuration format.
1.3: Now supports GitHub Enterprise and GitHub Cloud.  This can be done via a GitHub App or by manual webhook definitions.
1.2: Fixed problem where pooled connections to the SCM would cause PR failures when the network routing fabric discarded the connection route.
BREAKING CHANGE - Added a new configuration option for the CxOneFlow server base URL used to host image artifacts used in PR feedback comments.
Fixed an issue with `ssl-verify` not working with self-signed CAs.
1.1: Added more verbose logging to aid in troubleshooting feedback workflows.
Fixed an issue where the feedback scan polling parameters were ignored in some configurations.
Added result summary to PR feedback comments.
If detailed PR feedback comment content exceeds the SCM's comment limit, the comment will be limited to the summary content.
Fixed an issue with the scan permalink published in the PR feedback comments.
1.0: Stabilize Azure DevOps Enterprise Cloud basic authorization implementation.
ADO service hook test ping now fails if the correct shared secret is not provided.
0.2: Support for Azure DevOps Enterprise Cloud.
Pull-request feedback workflows are now available.
0.1: Webhook Endpoint support for BitBucket Data Center (BBDC) and Azure DevOps Enterprise (ADOE).
Scan on push to protected branches.
Scan on pull-request targeting protected branches.
